item.title: 007: First Light may be an original story, but you might have missed plenty of homages to the Bonds that came before
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/007-first-light-may-be-an-original-story-but-you-might-have-missed-plenty-of-homages-to-the-bonds-that-came-before

Last night, we got our first good look at IO Interactive's upcoming James Bond game, 007: First Light. While the developer has said that First Light - or as it was previously known, Project 007 - will serve as an origin story for the spy, and not be a "gamification" of any of the films that have come before, last night's trailer still had a fair few nods to Bonds of the past.

Please note, I will be talking about events from the James Bond series generally below, so please be aware of potential spoilers for the films and books if you haven't already enjoyed them for yourself.

First up, there is this Bond's facial scar. As you can see in the trailer above, this young Bond may be fresh faced when it comes to life as an agent, but he has clearly had a few scrapes already, earning himself a long thin scar down his cheek.

While the Bonds in the films have not boasted a scar like this, the book version of Bond did. Ian Flemming wrote that Bond had a three-inch long, thin vertical scar running down his right cheek. You can see some artwork of this book-based Bond below.

Meanwhile, given his overall look in the game, many have surmised that the actor playing James Bond in First Light is Patrick Gibson from Dexter: Original Sin (I have asked IO if they can confirm this).

In addition to this physical trait, there are also multiple other nods to the James Bond book and film series scattered throughout First Light's trailer that hint to the story, such as Bond's parents dying in a climbing-related accident.

Meanwhile, the trailer says 009 is a "master manipulator", which made me think this was a little tease for him being a bit of a bad egg that fooled and betrayed his country a la Sean Bean's 006 from GoldenEye. A little number flip there from IO?

On the cars and gadget side of things, because of course Bond is going to have cars and gadgets, First Light again is honouring the series that has come before.

In IO's trailer, Bond can be seen entering Q branch, where he selects one from a number of watches. This watch obviously does more than tell the time, and triggers a blast from a nearby motorbike, which again is in keeping with Bond's watches from the series.

While in the Sean Connory era, Bond often sported a Rolex Submariner, in many of the later films he changed things up a bit, with the agent wearing watches such as a Pulsar LED digital and a Seiko 0674 LC at times.

In 2006's Casino Royale, which marked Daniel Craig's first outing as the MI6 agent, Vesper Lynd commented on Bond's watch: "Rolex?" she asks. "Omega," he replies. Bond's watches are a big deal, and in First Light, IO has partnered with Omega once again.

Speaking of partnering with a known Bond-brand again, of course we will see the agent in an Aston Martin in First Light.

This vehicle is slicker than Moore's bus from Live and Let Die, but it is the same as the actors' yellow Aston Martin DBS from The Persauders, so another little nod to the series' legacy.

Additionally, we can see IO's Bond chasing down a red sports car in the First Light trailer, which reminded me a bit of the playful chase between Pierce Brosnan's Bond and Xenia Onatopp in GoldenEye.

Setting the scene further, then, we also saw a chess game being played during last night's trailer. Now, we don't clearly see who is playing chess here, so it could be Bond flexing his prowess like he often does at cards. And is that a martini, shaken not stirred?

That said, in From Russia with Love, there is a scene where Bond baddy Kronsteen plays chess, so as soon as I saw this moment in the First Light trailer, I thought of that. Essentially, baddies play chess, right?

There is a clip towards the end of the trailer where a speed boat zips through some islands very much like those from The Man With the Golden Gun (Khao Phing Kan, but known also as James Bond Island, no less). This is one of my favourite James Bond locations, so I was pleased to see this pop up.

Also, the Junks in this scene are much like those of Scaramanger's.

Last up for this piece (I am sure I will be doing more, because guys, it's Bond!), the music played over the trailer was the theme from On Her Majesty's Secret Service. You can have a listen to it below.

007: First Light is set for release in 2026. Towards the end of last year, IO said it hopes its upcoming James Bond origin story will be the start of a trilogy.

007: First Light will also feature again later this week during IO's own showcase, which is scheduled for Friday, 6th June, at 6pm PDT. That's 2am on 7th June for those of us in the UK.

item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 launch day live
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/nintendo-switch-2-launch-day-live

Today's the day. After months and years of speculation about what Nintendo's Switch 2 will be, today, it releases in the wild. You'll be able to get your mitts on it and tell us what you think. Are you as excited by Mario Kart World as the, um, world seems to be? What do you make of the Switch 2 upgrades for games like The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild? Is Welcome Tour really worth the £8 Nintendo is asking for? And Will the Switch 2 launch go as smoothly and successfully as Nintendo hopes?

We'll be covering all aspects of the Switch 2 launch and gathering everything together here so you can see at a glance what's been going on. We'll be keeping an eye on any launch issues there may be, any launch stock there may be, and how the world is reacting to playing Nintendo's new machine. And that includes you - we want to hear what you think in the comments below.

If you are receiving a Switch 2 today, here are a few articles you might find helpful:

  • Here's where you can find the SD memory slot on Switch 2 and some explanation about which SD memory cards you can use (Digital Foundry has helpfully compiled a list of the best Micro SD memory cards around)
  • Here's a list of all the games you can play on Switch 2 at launch
  • Here's why you need to install the day-one Switch 2 update
  • And here's a completely timely review of Nintendo's controversial and expensive handheld games machine (sorry)

There's lots still to come, such as our review thoughts about Switch 2 and Digital Foundry's take on the hardware, so pull up a virtual chair as we welcome Switch 2 to the world.

  • 12:01 pm June 05 2025 Gimme that GameCube goodness

  • 11:55 am June 05 2025 I'm still waiting

  • 10:51 am June 05 2025 Switch 1 fans needn't worry

  • 10:16 am June 05 2025 Nintendo has hidden the SD card slot again

  • 09:36 am June 05 2025 A not-Switch 2 review

  • 09:34 am June 05 2025 Where to find Switch 2 stock today

  • 09:23 am June 05 2025 Switch 2 deliveries are arriving for some

12:28 pm UTC

Adrian Chiles has given me permission to stop work and start playing games

I was just on Radio 5 Live chatting about Switch 2. Adrian Chiles has given me permission to just play the console for the rest of time basically, so I guess this may be the last you hear from me XD Guys, it has been a pleasure!

– Victoria Phillips Kennedy

12:01 pm UTC

Gimme that GameCube goodness

Like my colleagues, I am also sat waiting impatiently for a package to arrive. It's quite rude of the post to be this late, frankly. Don't they know I need to be playing F-Zero GX on a Switch 2 right now, even though I have a copy on a shelf next to me I could already be playing?

– Ed Nightingale

11:55 am UTC

– Victoria Phillips Kennedy

11:12 am UTC

Minor thing, but I'm already a big fan of the way the Joy-Con now clip in to the Switch. So much better than the slide system we had on the OG Switch.

– Tom Orry

10:51 am UTC

Switch 1 fans needn't worry

Not everyone can or wants to jump into a new console on day one, but thankfully the Switch is still home to loads of games and it's doubtful you've played all of them. Our own Christian Donlan reckons you should get Burnout Paradise if you're yet to give it a whirl.

– Tom Orry

10:47 am UTC

Anyone played any games other than Mario Kart World yet? I've got a little impressions article going live soon about what I think is one of the best launch games.

– Tom Orry

10:36 am UTC

Rogueywon says: The bit about not removing the film that comes on the screen absolutely is a valid piece of PSA advice. Nintendo themselves and some retailers are sharing that warning.

Thank you. Then please everyone bear this in mind!

– Robert Purchese

10:31 am UTC

vert1go/Lifeis2-D says: Probably best to remind everyone in case they missed it but DO NOT REMOVE THE FILM ALREADY ON THE SCREEN, Nintendo put it there in case of accidents!

Is this a genuine PSA piece of advice?

– Robert Purchese

10:16 am UTC

Nintendo has hidden the SD card slot again

If you know where the SD card slot on the Switch 2 is, this might seem obvious, but trust me when I say we have plenty of data to show that a lot of people couldn't find it on the OG Switch. So, if you are struggling to locate the slot on the Switch 2, it's under the kickstand. More info is in our handy guide on how to locate the Switch 2 SD card slot.

– Tom Orry

09:56 am UTC

Here's a question. How reckless of me is it, on a scale of one-to-good-god-no-Bertie, to not use a screen protector on the Switch 2?

– Robert Purchese

09:55 am UTC

H1ppyDave says: Screen protector - use a credit card with a piece of cardboard folded over it. For that bubble I’d personally Lift it carefully back up (Inuse a guitar plectrum but anything thin made of plastic should do) and let it resettle.

OMG, H1ppyDave, you're a star. I had been pressing it with just a cloth and had no luck. Used your suggestion and now I'm bubble-free! May your Switch 2 launch day be wonderful!

– Tom Orry

09:45 am UTC

Waiting on Argos from the wilds of Scotland

I am sitting at my desk, twitching like an anxious meerkat because I really, really want my Switch 2 to arrive. One small sound from outside, and I look up and out of the window, hoping it is that glorious DPD van pulling up outside my front door. So far, though, it hasn't been. Boo :(

I live in the wilds of Scotland, and Matt has joked the delivery driver is probably still trying to work out how to get to my house. I really hope they figure it out soon...

– Victoria Phillips Kennedy

09:44 am UTC

Anyone good with screen protector woes? I applied a tempered glass protector, and it seemed to go perfectly, but then this spot never filled in properly. Is this a "get a new protector" situation? Anyone managed to fix this before? You are my only hope Eurogamer readers.

– Tom Orry

09:37 am UTC

Anand Modha says: I haven't got one yet, was planning to when I'd finished some personal projects. Going online and seeing so many people happy and playing is awesome. I love new console day, who ever is releasing.

There is a lovely energy about a day like this, isn't there? An infectious excitement.

– Robert Purchese

09:36 am UTC

A not-Switch 2 review

Given Nintendo's decision to hold review units until launch we won't be able to offer a detailed hardware review until next week, but we do have this: a review of Nintendo's other controversial handheld console.

Spoilers: It's the Virtual Boy!

– Tom Orry

09:34 am UTC

Where to find Switch 2 stock today

If you're suddenly feeling a rush of excitement to buy a Switch 2 and don't know where to look, we've got you covered. Here are the shops being restocked with Switch 2 stock today.

– Robert Purchese

09:32 am UTC

Rogueywon says: I think DF tried plugging in the cat litter. Conclusions: not great, but framerates generally better than the Series S.

Oof - yowsers!

– Robert Purchese

09:29 am UTC

Rogueywon says: For clarity, I didn't receive cat litter, but some people did and it got media coverage.

I see, I see. I wonder if anyone tried to plug it in.

– Robert Purchese

09:28 am UTC

My son's Switch 2 is due between 1 and 2pm, so he'll have a nice surprise when he gets back from school. Straight on Fortnite, no doubt.

– Tom Orry

09:28 am UTC

Fallout2 says: My Switch 2 just arrived. Woo!

Congratulations!

kyleayy says: I went and picked mine up from Curry's earlier!

Congratulations!

Benjigrin says: Mine is due at 17:30 🙄 DPD are never early on new console day 😡it's was 17:30 for ... PS4, Switch, Xbox One X, Series X and PS5, my heart sinks when it's DPD you never know till 10 am on the day 🥲

Oof! At least you'll be clear of work for the day then, presumably.

Madame-Drofla says: Mines is arriving between half past one and half past two :]

Very nice, very nice.

– Robert Purchese

09:25 am UTC

Rogueywon says: Oof, painful delivery troll. At least it wasn't cat litter. That PS5 launch day felt like a particularly grim lottery.

Hang on, hang on, let's wind this back. Are you saying you received cat litter instead of a PS5?

– Robert Purchese

09:23 am UTC

Switch 2 deliveries are arriving for some

We're all excitedly waiting for our Switch 2s to arrive at Eurogamer. Spare a moment for our guides editor, Lottie, though. Perhaps the best troll delivery of all time.

To quote Lottie: "I'm going back to bed. The day is ruined."

– Tom Orry

09:22 am UTC

– Robert Purchese

09:21 am UTC

Hello and good morning to you. Wishing you all the best of luck with your deliveries and for their speedy arrivals. Let's hope no Switch 2s get left on the porch today.

– Robert Purchese
